newsitem.title: USA: Maxco sells Akemi unit for about $2 mln.
newsitem.headline: Maxco sells Akemi unit for about $2 mln.

text.p: Maxco Inc said Tuesday it sold its Akemi Inc subsidiary to a newly formed subsidiary of a French concern, AXSON North America, a Houston, Texas-based unit of privately held AXSON S.A. for about $2 million.

No material gain or loss will be recognized as a result of the transaction. However, Maxco said certain losses related to the discontinuance of the Akemi business would be reflected in the quarter ended December 31, 1996.
As part of the transaction, Maxco said it will buy about 7.4 percent of the capital stock of AXSON S.A.

Following the sale of Akemi, Maxco said it expects to post net sales from continuing operations of about $70 million for its fiscal year ending March 31, 1997. On an annualized basis, Maxco's remaining businesses represent a revenue base of approximately $100 million.
Akemi, an Eaton Rapids, Mich.-based developer and manufacturer of proprietary polyester and epoxy compounds, posted operating losses over the past two years on modest revenues. It employs 25 people.
Akemi represented a nominal percentage of Maxco's assets and accounted for about 4.5 percent of Maxco's $80.2 million of consolidated net sales from continuing operations in fiscal 1996.
AXSON S.A., which posted worldwide revenues of about $27 million last year, was formed in October 1994 following a management buyout of Stamford, Conn.-based Hexcel Corp's European resin group.
Maxco's businesses include heat-treating services, polyethylene packaging and two construction supply subsidiaries. It also holds real estate investments and 20 percent of Medar Inc.
